title: Ticket #3815: Projection introduced in #3366 breaks concurrency limits
description:
The resource ad projection introduced on #3366 does not include the ConcurrrencyLimits attribute, which is required to recompute concurrency limit counts at the beginning of each negotiation cycle.

The effect is that concurrency limits used in previous cycles are not counted, and so concurrency limits won't be respected across multiple cycles.
remarks:
2013-Jul-26 11:13:31 by eje:
TEST/REPRO

A good way to exercise the behavior across multiple cycles is to set up a p-slot with (say) 4 cpus, and configure a concurrency limit of 3. "consider-preemption" must be false: 

NUM_CPUS = 4

SLOT_TYPE_1 = 100%
SLOT_TYPE_1_PARTITIONABLE = True
NUM_SLOTS_TYPE_1 = 1

# Turn off preemption.   It's crucial to set "NEGOTIATOR_CONSIDER_PREEMPTION = False" for repro.
CLAIM_WORKLIFE=0
MAXJOBRETIREMENTTIME = 3600
PREEMPT = False
RANK = 0
PREEMPTION_REQUIREMENTS = False
NEGOTIATOR_CONSIDER_PREEMPTION = False
NEGOTIATOR_MATCHLIST_CACHING = False

# verbose logging
ALL_DEBUG = D_FULLDEBUG | D_ACCOUNTANT

# reduce daemon update latencies
NEGOTIATOR_INTERVAL = 30
SCHEDD_INTERVAL = 15

# A concurrency limit
YYZ_LIMIT = 3

Submit >= 4 jobs, subject to the cc-limit: 

universe = vanilla
cmd = /bin/sleep
args = 300
should_transfer_files = never
concurrency_limits = YYZ
queue 10

Before the fix, you should see one job match per cycle, and 4 jobs will run, instead of 3, which is the correct behavior. In the negotiator log, you will see that the used concurrency limits are "forgotten" each cycle, because the ConcurrencyLimits attribute is not present on the claimed dynamic-slots.

after the fix, you should see that the number of running jobs is capped at 3, and concurrency limit accounting is correctly maintained across each cycle.
